newsitem.title: USA: Networking software shrs hit after EPS warnings.
newsitem.headline: Networking software shrs hit after EPS warnings.

text.p: A flurry of earnings warnings sent shares in network software and systems tools companies tumbling on Tuesday, with several of the issues losing more than a third of their market value.

Segue Software Inc, DataWorks Corp, XcelleNet Inc and Wall Data Inc were all off about 35 percent at midday, a day after each of them warned investors upcoming earnings would fall short of Wall Street estimates.
Early today, analysts began ratcheting back expectations for the companies, with Segue Software receiving the majority of the early attention.
SoundView Financial cut estimates on Segue for fiscal 1997 and 1998 but kept its rating on the shares at buy.
Alex. Brown analyst James Moore was more pessimistic, downgrading the shares to market perform from buy and expressing doubts over Segue's ability to bounce back soon.
"It gets down to an inability to execute," Moore said. "The management team has not proven they are capable of selling software."
Moore discounted the notion that industry-wide issues were behind the earnings problems faced by Segue, the only one of the four companies he follows.
"This is a very robust market and demand is strong," he said.
Wall Data, in addition to forecasting weak results, surprised analysts by announcing its chairman Jim Simpson would retire at the end of the month.
The earnings preview marked the third time in a little more than two years that Wall Data had warned it would miss estimates.
Last October, the company lost about a third of its value after an earnings shortfall.
DataWorks, in its statement disclosing the second quarter earnings weakness, cited "timing delays" on customer orders including a large order moving out of the second quarter.

XcelleNet said in its statement that its year-over-year revenue growth in the quarter was a "clear disappointment" at about 19 percent, down sharply from more than 40 percent in each of the two preceding quarters.
XcelleNet was downgraded by Alex. Brown analyst Chris Mortenson to market perform from buy early today.
Shares in Segue Software tumbled 4-7/8 to 8-1/4, the steepest decliner on Nasdaq. XcelleNet stood second on the Nasdaq percentage losers list, sliding 5-1/8 to 8-3/4.
Dataworks shed seven to 12-1/2 to stand third among decliners and Wall Data fell 9-3/4 to 18, good for fourth place.
